name: Heritage and Values of the United States Air Force
desc: Part one of a two-part course that examines the opportunities of an Air Force officer, as well as the structure and function of the Air Force.

name: Heritage and Values of the United States Air Force
desc: Part two of a two-part course that examines the opportunities of an Air Force officer, as well as the structure and function of the Air Force.

name: Seminar
desc: Seminar in topics related to the United States Air Force.
Repeat: May be repeated for credit. 6 total credits. 2 total completions.

name: Independent Study
desc: Readings and research of topics regarding the United States Air Force.
Repeat: May be repeated for credit. 6 total credits. 2 total completions.

name: Team and Air Force Leadership Fundamentals
desc: This course lays the foundation for leading effective teams and developing leadership skills.

name: Team and Air Force Leadership Fundamentals II
desc: This course continues to lay the foundation for leading effective teams and developing leadership skills.

name: Air Power and Modern Warfare
desc: Examines air power theory and practice from 1914 to the present. Focuses on the application of air power as an instrument of war and the effectiveness of that application.

name: Leading People and Effective Communication I
desc: Part one of a two-part course concerning contemporary leadership and management of the Air Force Officer.

name: Leading People and Effective Communication II
desc: Part two of a two-part course concerning contemporary leadership and management of the Air Force Officer.

name: Air and Space Expeditionary Training
desc: Provides leadership training in a military environment.  Professional development is achieved through academics, physical fitness, marksmanship, and leadership exercises.  Course reviews leadership lessons in a simulated expeditionary deployment to a combat zone. Restricted to ROTC cadets from all services.

name: National Security Affairs and Preparation for Active Duty
desc: Part one of a two-part class that examines the basic elements of national security policy and process issues relevant to new Air Force officers.

name: National Security Affairs and Preparation for Active Duty
desc: Part two of a two-part class that examines the basic elements of national security policy and process issues relevant to new Air Force officers.

name: Leadership Laboratory
desc: Required for all AFROTC cadets. The purpose of the LLAB program is to augment  the AFROTC academic curriculum by providing prospective Air Force officers the opportunities and feedback needed to develop the leadership, managerial, and supervisory skills required of successful Air Force officers. The laboratory also offers insight into career opportunities in the USAF, life, and work of the USAF junior officer, and military ceremonies.
